instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one USB port not working
threads.message: 2936 had a loose usb port that would light up a mouse but not move it. I replaced the loose usb port with one from a donor board but now there is no power to it, When i check <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> pin 9 gets 5v but pin 8 is zero. One usb port works one does not. J4600 is the one not working. Any advice or things I should do or check would be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one USB port not working
